meanings.definition: A scientific procedure undertaken to make a discovery, test a hypothesis, or demonstrate a known fact.
meanings.sent1: During the science class, we conducted an experiment to see if plants grow better with sunlight or artificial light.
meanings.sent2: The students were excited to start their chemistry experiment in the laboratory.
meanings.sent3: The experiment to see if cats like water involved filling a small pool with toys and watching from a safe distance.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to switch to a new skincare routine was an experiment that ended up being a success.
meanings.sent5: The experiment to bake a cake without sugar was a disaster, resulting in a tasteless dessert.

meanings.definition: A course of action tentatively adopted without being sure of the outcome.
meanings.sent1: Trying a new study method before the exam was an experiment to see if it would improve grades.
meanings.sent2: The company's decision to launch a new product was a risky experiment in the competitive market.
meanings.sent3: His experiment of wearing mismatched socks to work was met with confused looks from his colleagues.
meanings.sent4: Embarking on a solo trip to a foreign country was an experiment in independence for the young traveler.
meanings.sent5: The experiment of trying a new restaurant without checking reviews first turned out to be a delightful surprise.
